p:
Laboratory exams of infected patients showed alterations in haematology and biochemistry. It was verified the increase of leukocytes and the reduction of lymphocytes; increased D-dimer and erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), prolongation in prothrombin times (PT), followed by increase in bilirubin levels, aspartate transaminase (AST), alanine transaminase (ALT), creatinine, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), protein C reactive (PCR), hypoalbuminemia (low albumin), microcytosis and thrombocytopenia.
43
